newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore bunkers quotes higher on crude gains.
newsitem.headline: Singapore bunkers quotes higher on crude gains.

text.p: Singapore bunker quotes were firmer on crude gains but buyers remained on the sidelines for prices to ease later Monday.

Majors were asking $121-$122 per tonne for 180-cst and at $117-$118 for 380-cst. Independents quoted a shade lower at $115 for 380-cst and $120 for 180-cst. On Friday, 380-cst was quoted at $113-$116 and 180-cst at $119-$122.
Traders said enquiries were thin with demand also dampened by a Japanese holiday.
MDO prices stayed at $212-$218 and gas oil at $222-$228.
